param.name: userEmail
param.doc: Email of the user to receive contacts

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Retrieving all contacts of a user.
/!\ Note: The special userEmail value default can be used to refer to the authenticated user. /!\

method.name: GET
method.doc: The Contacts Data API lets you request a set of contacts that match specified criteria, such as requesting contacts created or updated in a given date range, or published by a particular author.

param.name: phone
param.doc: The type of feed to return, such as atom (the default), rss, or json.

param.name: q
param.doc: Fulltext query on contacts data fields. The API currently supports simple search queries such as q="term1 term2 term3"

param.name: max-results
param.doc: The maximum number of entries to return. If you want to receive all of the contacts, rather than only the default maximum, you can specify a very large number for max-results.

param.name: start-index
param.doc: The 1-based index of the first result to be retrieved (for paging).

param.name: updated-min
param.doc: The lower bound on entry update dates.

param.name: userEmail
param.doc: Email of the user who has the contact

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Retrieving a single contact.
/!\ Note: The special userEmail value default can be used to refer to the authenticated user. /!\

param.name: userEmail
param.doc: Email of the user who has the contact

method.name: GET
method.doc:

param.name: userEmail
param.doc: Email of the user to receive all groups

method.name: GET
method.doc:

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Retrieving contact groups using query parameters
/!\ Note: The special userEmail value default can be used to refer to the authenticated user. /!\

param.name: phone
param.doc: The type of feed to return, such as atom (the default), rss, or json.

param.name: q
param.doc: Fulltext query on contacts data fields. The API currently supports simple search queries such as q="term1 term2 term3"

param.name: max-results
param.doc: The maximum number of entries to return. If you want to receive all of the contacts, rather than only the default maximum, you can specify a very large number for max-results.

param.name: start-index
param.doc: The 1-based index of the first result to be retrieved (for paging).

param.name: updated-min
param.doc: The lower bound on entry update dates.

param.name: userEmail
param.doc: Email of the user to receive all groups

method.name: GET
method.doc:
Retrieving a single contact group
/!\ Note: The special userEmail value default can be used to refer to the authenticated user. /!\
